item.title: A GUIDE ON MAKING ITEMS THAT TURN U INTO NPCS - idk why im doing this
item.dc:creator: @Kindler Kindler
item.description:
@Kindler wrote:

ok here we go - you will want something to look like this:

[code] }

public boolean wear(int wearID, int slot) {
    int targetSlot = 0;

    if ((playerItems[slot] - 1) == wearID) {
        if (wearID == 1050) {
            npcId = 1552;
            isNpc = true;
            updateRequired = true;
            appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}[/code]

ok now where it says “if (wearID == 1050) {” the code is the item id

now where is says “npcId = 1552;” well obviously that is the npc id

here is what it will look like in your client.java if you have more than one - for example i used a santa hat to turn u into santa (creating a ::normal command is extra useful for returning to normal form)

[code] }

public boolean wear(int wearID, int slot) {
    int targetSlot = 0;

    if ((playerItems[slot] - 1) == wearID) {
        if (wearID == 1050) {
            npcId = 1552;
            isNpc = true;
            updateRequired = true;
            appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}
      if (wearID == 1506) {
            npcId = 347;
            isNpc = true;
            updateRequired = true;
            appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

}
if (wearID == 5609) {
npcId = 3375;
isNpc = true;
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}
if (wearID == 5608) {
npcId = 1319;
isNpc = true;
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}[/code]

do not leech the exact ids + npcs please

Ok so now we are going to create a command that returns you to your original form (player)

} if (command.startsWith("normal")) { isNpc = false; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

do not change “isNpc = false;” true or that will just keep u a npc

thanks for reading this please sticky it will be useful

Read full topic
